intro: Carex flava var. uetliaca, commonly known as the yellow sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Central America. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges, and is characterized by its triangular stems and grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that contain wind-pollinated flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
